settings.heading: Our Mission and Purpose

settings.title: Why We Exist
settings.answer:
Our co-founder, Lena Phoenix, likes to say, ‚ÄúThere is NO reason to start another shoe company‚Ä¶ unless your products change people‚Äôs lives.‚Äù

And if you read the reviews of our shoes and sandals, you‚Äôll hear a lot of people saying just that, even if what was life-changing for them is as simple as finding shoes that are COMFORTABLE.

Frankly, it‚Äôs the emails, phone calls, reviews, and letters (yes, actual letters delivered by a mail person) where people share how much Xero Shoes has impacted their lives that keep us going.

We‚Äôre creating a MOVEMENT movement: Helping people experience the comfort, fun, and benefits of Natural Movement. And making natural movement the obvious, healthy, choice‚Ä¶ the way natural food is currently.

settings.title: We believe in ‚ÄúEnvironmentally Intelligent‚Äù design
settings.answer:
One of our goals is being respectful stewards of our environment and the planet.

With footwear, especially, performance footwear, there are some limitations to what we can do while still providing the durability, usability, and function our customers want, at a price they can afford.

We‚Äôre careful not to jump into ‚Äúsustainable‚Äù or ‚Äúenvironmentally beneficial‚Äù products or methods without looking at the bigger picture. For example, creating fleece from recycled plastic bottles¬†sounds¬†like a great thing‚Ä¶ until it was discovered that fleece sheds synthetic microfibers ‚Äî tiny bits of plastic that marine scientists say could be jeopardizing our oceans.

We think of our measured, long-term vision approach as being ‚ÄúEnvironmentally Intelligent.‚Äù

Some of the ways we do this include:

  • Our minimalist designs use fewer materials than traditional shoes (especially the performance products)
  • Our simpler designs, without midsole layers, require less energy to manufacture
  • Our soles last longer ‚Äî where most performance shoe companies recommend replacing their products every 3-500 miles, our soles have a¬†5,000 mile sole warranty.
  • Whenever possible, we use renewable materials, like hemp

We look forward to more and better ways we can ‚Äútread lightly‚Äù as we help you Live Life Feet First!

settings.heading: Minimalist & Barefoot shoe info

settings.title: Why should I wear Natural Movement (a.k.a. minimalist shoes or barefoot shoes)?
settings.answer:
Let me ask you a question: Do your feet feel better at the end of the day than they did at the beginning?

If not, it‚Äôs because your shoes aren‚Äôt letting your feet do what‚Äôs NATURAL.

One quarter of the bones and joints in your entire body are in your feet. You have more nerve endings in your soles than anywhere but your fingertips and lips.

This means your feet are meant to bend, to move, to flex, and feel the world.

Comfort and performance come from letting your feet do what they‚Äôre meant to do, naturally.

Xero Shoes let them do that with what we call ‚Äú3 Pillars of Natural‚Äù:

  • Natural FIT ‚Äî wide toe boxes let your toes spread and relax. A non-elevated (zero-drop) heel for proper posture.
  • Natural MOTION ‚Äî super flexible to let your feet bend and move naturally. Low-to-the-ground for balance and agility.
  • Natural FEEL ‚Äî the patented FeelTrue¬Æ soles give you just-right protection while still giving the ground feedback your brain needs for efficient, natural movement.

Plus they‚Äôre affordable, and so durable that they have a 5,000 mile sole warranty.

For running, you might start with a VERY short run‚Ä¶ like 30 seconds! If that‚Äôs not fun, there are a number of hints on our site that will help you. When a short run feels easy and fun, add 10 more seconds to your next run. Then ‚Äúlather, rinse, repeat.‚Äù

Listen to your body. Use fun as your guide.

settings.title: Do your shoes have arch support?
settings.answer:
Xero Shoes are designed to let your feet do what‚Äôs natural ‚Äî bend, flex, move and feel the world.

Research shows that ‚Äúsupporting‚Äù your arch can make your foot weaker in as little as a few weeks, while even just walking in a minimalist shoe can improve foot muscle strength.

We want to let your feet be feet‚Ä¶ and support you for life.

Since our soles are flat, with no built-in arch support, they‚Äôre probably the best shoe to use if you decide to add an insole.

So you know, though, our shoes are intentionally designed to let your feet bend, flex, and move naturally. Research shows that ‚Äúsupporting‚Äù your arch or immobilizing your foot with an orthotic can make your foot weaker in as little as a few weeks, while even just walking in a minimalist shoe can improve foot muscle strength.

settings.title: Where are your shoes made?
settings.answer:
We design all of our shoes here in Colorado. Xero Shoes are responsibly, ethically, and fairly manufactured in China.

While we would love to manufacture in America, it is literally not possible at this time, in the same way it‚Äôs not possible to domestically manufacture the device you‚Äôre using to read this answer.

Performance footwear manufacturing moved to Asia in the 70s and shows no likelihood of moving back. Note that some companies that claim ‚Äúmade in America‚Äù are still sourcing their materials from overseas (or the US companies from which they buy their materials are doing so).

We visit and work with our factories multiple times per year.¬† We also have an on-the-ground manufacturing agent who oversees the factories when we‚Äôre not there to ensure that conditions are good, workers are treated fairly, and the shoes are made in compliance with all local laws and regulations. The factories we use treat and pay their workers exceptionally well.

Companies much larger than ours use these same factories and have spent millions of dollars on audits to assure themselves and their wholesale partners about the quality and conditions.

settings.title: Can your shoes be used for grounding/earthing?
settings.answer:
While our shoes are low to the ground for balance and agility, and flexible enough to let your feet bend and move naturally, our shoes are not electrically conductive.

We have heard from some customers who made their Xero Shoes conductive by putting a rivet or grommet through the soles but we do not have any personal experience with this.

Please keep in mind that any alterations to the shoes would not be covered under warranty.

settings.title: How do I know if these are the right size?
settings.answer:
The simplest answer is: Do they feel right?

Sizing is largely about personal preference. You could take 3 people with identical feet, put them in the same shoe, and they‚Äôd have 3 different opinions about how the shoe fits.

Some people think you need a lot of room in front of your toes. This is true for shoes with thick midsoles, but not with Xero Shoes (when thicker shoes bend, the ‚Äúinside‚Äù shortens faster than the outside‚Ä¶ like what happens when you bend a phone book).

Some people like their toes to lightly touch the front of the shoe because it gives them additional feedback.

We recommend wearing the shoes indoors for a bit to see how they feel (remember, if you need to return or exchange, the product must be in ‚Äúnew and unworn‚Äù condition).

If you‚Äôre a woman with a wider foot, you may be more comfortable in a ‚Äúmen‚Äôs‚Äù style. And if you‚Äôre a man with a narrower foot, you may like a ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs‚Äù style better.

If you have other questions about fit, feel free to reach out so we can help!

settings.heading: I don‚Äôt see a referral that I made. Why not?
settings.answer:
First, it takes about 15-30 minutes until the affiliate software updates and shows the clicks and/or commissions from people you referred.

Secondly, a prospect or customer is assigned to the first affiliate who referred that person to Xero Shoes. So, if your referral came to XeroShoes.com or XeroShoes.eu before clicking on your affiliate link, they‚Äôre not linked to you.

Next, sometimes people *think* they clicked on your affiliate link, but may not have.

If you aren‚Äôt seeing a referral or commission that you believe you should, contact¬†affiliates@xeroshoes.com¬†and we‚Äôll investigate. If there is an actual problem, we can correct it, however, Post Affiliate Pro‚Äôs tracking system is very rarely wrong.

settings.answer: Transactions are most often declined when someone‚Äôs credit card is declined, usually from a typo. More often than not, you‚Äôll see a second transaction immediately after that did go through, marked ‚Äúpending‚Äù.

settings.heading: Where‚Äôs my commission?
settings.answer:
We pay commissions monthly based on the following formula:

When a referred customer makes a purchase, any commission is marked as ‚ÄúPending.‚Äù To allow a grace period for returns or other adjustments, we wait for 30 days before the commission status is changed to ‚ÄúApproved.‚Äù Commissions are then paid on the 5th of the following month, with a minimum payout of $20.

For example, if someone you refer to our site makes a purchase on January 20th, the commission is marked as ‚ÄúApproved‚Äù on February 20th, and paid on March 5th, assuming your total commissions due is over $20.¬†

If you haven‚Äôt reached the $20 threshold, the commissions will ‚Äúroll over‚Äù to subsequent months until you have, and then you will receive your commission payment.
